intro: Cynanchica staliana subsp. diomedea, commonly known as the Greek milkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southeastern Europe. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae, which is characterized by its milky sap and showy flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands. Its flowers are usually pale yellow to greenish-white, with a distinctive corona surrounding the ovary. The subspecies diomedea is distinguished by its specific geographic distribution and morphological traits compared to other subspecies of Cynanchica staliana.
